laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Later serum samples yielded titers of 1:64 (approximately day 260) and 1:32 (after ~5 years)

laboratory_examinations.findings: WBC count, 162 cells/mm³ (65% neutrophils, 27% lymphocytes, 8% monocytes); RBC count, 2 cells/mm³; glucose level, 73 mg/dL; protein level, 41 mg/dL
Edema in the left temporal/parietal area of the brain
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up MRI (19 days later) showed 2 large (3.0 and 3.5 cm) distinct ring-enhancing lesions

laboratory_examinations.findings: Acute suppurative and necrotizing inflammation with structures consistent with amoebas; Balamuthia identified in brain biopsy by IIF
Persistence of 2 ring-enhancing lesions that decreased in size from 3.5 and 3.0 cm to 2.4 and 2.7 cm respectively
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Resolution of surrounding edema with partial calcification
